message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the nervous systems of different organisms. Option (A) is incorrect because phones do not have brains or bodies. Option (B) is incorrect because rocks are inanimate objects and do not have brains or bodies. Option (D) is incorrect because bacteria are single-celled organisms that do not have brains or bodies. Option (C) is the most accurate statement because sloths are living organisms that have brains that control their bodies.

This question requires basic knowledge about the nervous systems of different organisms. Option (A) is incorrect because phones do not have brains or bodies in the same way that living organisms do. Option (B) is incorrect because rocks are not living organisms and do not have brains or bodies. Option (C) is the correct answer because sloths are living organisms and have brains that control their bodies. Option (D) is incorrect because bacteria are single-celled organisms that do not have brains or bodies in the same way that more complex organisms do.

This question tests knowledge of the basic anatomy and physiology of different organisms. A sloth's brain controls its body and is responsible for coordinating movement, regulating body functions, and processing sensory information. Option (A) is incorrect because phones do not have brains or bodies. Option (B) is incorrect because rocks do not have brains or bodies. Option (D) is incorrect because bacteria do not have brains or bodies.

This question requires knowledge about the nervous system and how different organisms control their bodies. Among the given options, the most accurate statement is (C) a sloth's brain controls its body. Sloths, like other vertebrates, have a central nervous system that includes a brain. The brain sends signals to control the sloth's body movements and functions. Option (A) is incorrect because while phones have internal components that function as a "brain," they do not have a biological body that requires control. Option (B) is incorrect because rocks do not have brains or any control over their bodies. Option (D) is incorrect because bacteria are microscopic organisms that lack a brain or a central nervous system.

This question requires basic knowledge about the anatomy and physiology of different organisms. The most accurate statement is (C) a sloth's brain controls its body. Sloths, like other mammals, have a central nervous system that includes a brain and spinal cord. The brain controls various functions and movements of the body, including motor skills, sensory perception, and behavior. Options (A) and (B) are incorrect because phones and rocks do not have brains or bodies that can be controlled in the same way living organisms do. Option (D) is incorrect because bacteria are single-celled organisms and do not have a central nervous system or a brain.
